headline: Hibachi-Style Fried Rice
description: Hibachi-style fried rice cooked with chicken, green onion, egg, and soy sauce is a quick and easy side dish to any meal. It can be easily customized.
name: Hibachi-Style Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a wok or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat; add olive oil. Cook and stir eggs in the hot oil until cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken, green onion, and garlic to scrambled eggs; cook and stir until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Mix rice into egg mixture; cook and stir until rice is warmed, about 2 minutes. Add soy sauce; cook and stir until rice mixture is evenly coated, about 3 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I really love this recipe. I use half olive oil half sesame oil. I like the added flavor of the sesame oil.

The Fam loved it. no leftovers to fight over.
Easy to make and very flavorful. i did make 1 small change, and cooked my rice in chicken broth. yummmmmm

This was one of the best fried rice recipes that I've made! I was looking for a way to use up some leftover white rice and diced up rotisserie chicken, and this was perfect. I also added in some diced zucchini and a bit of sesame oil at the end. Both my husband and I agreed that this was very good and one that we should make again. Quick and easy too!

OMG! This was a big hit at dinner tonight! I did make one small addition - I added some edamame. Otherwise, I made it as directed. It tasted so much like what I've had at hibachi restaurants and it was so easy!!
Very easy to make, I cooked a whole " beer can chicken" and used the breast for the meat. That way you still have legs, thighs and wings basically for the same money as just using breasts. Very good!
I used shrimp and peas instead of chicken and green onion respectively. I even tried it with sesame oil instead of olive oil once! Solid recipe. If you like a rich taste, even butter is an option.
Really easy and tasty. Only thing is next time I’m gonna cut back on the garlic a little. Just my preference.
My step son and his best friend said they felt like they were eating at a hibachi grill place! We all absolutely loved it! Next time, I’m going to add shrimp, scallops and lobster into it as well!!
Needs more eggs, more oil, and more soy sauce, but amazing otherwise
Delish and quick! I used 2 day old jasmine rice and cut up leftover baked chicken breast. I kicked it up a notch by adding a little cayenne pepper and green onion. Outstanding!
Exremly good
Easy to make and easy to customize. Best tasting homemade fried rice ever.
I used rice refrigerated overnight and safflower sesame oil for wok fried taste.
Very easy and tastes delish.
I used day old rice, added carrots! Great flavor and went well with hand made sushi and yum yum sauce!
Easy and good, was a hit with kids and adults
I don't know what i did wrong. Did not taste like hibachi and i needed alot more soy sauce.
Good recipe. To really make it Berger try using Calrose rice or Short/Medium grain rice that retains more moisture.
Very good. I add more garlic, green onion & soy sauce, I like a lot of flavor.
This fried rice was delicious and easy!
Best fried rice recipes I've ever used. I cook it a little longer than the recipe suggests because I like to have some crispy bits. Delicious!
Add bacon instead of chicken and it’s even more perfect. Love this!

This is the first recipe I've ever made that my kids both devoured! My son is very picky and he loved it! I added 1 tbsp of soy sauce per cup of rice which was perfect! I baked a pound of chicken breast in the oven and then cubed it before I added it to the recipe. I used Jasmine rice and added 1 extra cup to stretch the recipe a little more. This will now be in my weekly repertoire for sure.
It is the very good
Easy recipe and doubled it up and it was an instant hit! Now I’m gonna add other veggies and other meats
My fried rice turned out awesome! I added additional Ingredients: hoisin sauce and sesame oil. It turned out perfect
Great
Simple, easy and delicious!
Mmm. I used brown rice and cooled it down first. I also used half butter and half olive oil for the oil. Was really good!
This was really good! I did rice, egg, garlic and soy sauce and it tasted great. I followed other folks and made the rice the night before.

Perfect recipe. I just needed to get the basic flavor I was looking for. Now that I've made this a time or ten, I feel comfortable adding veggies and various meats that I like. Definitely my favorite go-to for leftover rice, in fact I find myself making extra rice so that this can be on the menu the next day.

I love adding mushrooms, baby bok choy, and shrimp. My favorite. I also cheat and use garlic paste. I also add a little sesame oil for flavor.
I added some yellow onion and a bit more garlic and soy sauce. It was very flavorful and super quick and easy to make! A great way to use any leftover veggies.

Did everything per the recipe EXCEPT, I sautéed some additional veggies (broccoli, baby corn, zucchini, onion) delicious! Just as good as the expensive hibachi restaurants. Will definitely make again. My husband raves about it for days
this was a last minute idea. we only had the rice, egg, soy sauce and olive oil. I also added butter and it was DELICIOUS!
Great
It's become one of our favorites!
Added Broccoli & Peas this is an excellent recipe for hibachi style rice at home!
I made this recipe from leftover rice and it was delicious. Will for sure make again. Thanks for this recipe!
We loved it and it was really simple.
No idea what went wrong...it was one giant, congealed lump. It smelled good and tasted okay, but I think I’m eating pizza now...

I change it up mince scallion onion and CARROT 3 eggs not two. Combine all vegetables in 5 tablespoons butter in frying pan. Cook. But Chinese food rice to save time and the consistency is better add rice to vegetables add eggs soy sauce to taste done
Used tofu instead of chicken. Will make again
pretty good i added salt and subtracted the chicken because my wife prefers pork i made it meatless pork next time.

I will make this again and again. 
I did increase the amount to 3 cups rice and used 3 eggs, etc.
It is wonderful!
Any meat or vegetables could be added for a meal.
I made with beef cubes seasoned with salt pepper and garlic.
Really a great dish. Definitely use day old rice and add onion, peas and carrots. Family favorite.
Made it by the recipe and it was perfect.
So impressed with this recipe, it tastes exactly like the hibachi rice at my local Japanese restaurant! Made it exactly as written!
NEVER use olive oil in a wok! Otherwise, simple and okay, nothing more.

This was awesome! I had been using another recipe I found on Pinterest for some time and I thought this one was way better. Followed the recipe as instructed, but added a little bit of sesame oil. And enjoyed it with some sriracha sauce. Delicious!
Quick, easy, and only a few ingredients. We usually grill some steak or chicken, make this rice, and throw out some Terry Ho’s Yum Yum Sauce for our “home-cooked hibachi” night.

I use this recipe as a base. I always add 1 medium onion, about a cup of frozen peas, usually 2 zucchini, and a can of water chestnuts. I start with cooking the onion for about 5 minutes on medium, then add the garlic(which I always double, we love garlic) and zucchini. After a couple minutes, I line the pan with all the veggies that I have cooked, making room in the center to cook the eggs. I add 1 T. of butter in the center for cooking the eggs. That little bit of butter adds another layer of flavor to the recipe. Once the eggs are done I add the rice, rest of the veggies, and soy sauce(4 to 6 Tablespoons). Before serving I also add salt and pepper to taste and about 1 teaspoon of sesame oil to it all and mix well. My son doesn't like the texture of sesame seeds. The sesame oil gives the taste of the seeds without the texture of them. Every time I make this everyone raves about how it's better than take out and just as good if not better than the hibachi restaurant. I hope this helps others. When it comes to cooking recipes, I love experimenting! BTW, I cooked the chicken separate. My son is autistic. I've learned to cook certain ways so he will eat everything. And chicken on the side and not mixed in is another thing that helps him. Enjoy!!
Made no changes to this recipe and it was a big hit. No leftovers at all. For my picky family that means it was really good.
Great recepie. Just if you dont have cooked chicken and rice already it would take a bit longer to make. Thank you!
This was great! I added some chopped bell pepper and a load of white mushrooms. Be sure to add soy sauce to taste. Crushed red pepper flakes added a bit of spice, too!
This is a good recipe! I used light soy sauce so I needed a touch of salt. Substituted chicken for chickpeas and added peas. Really yummy!

So fast and simple while being so flavorful! I did the freezer trick to be able to make the fried rice right after cooking my rice, and it worked well. I did half white rice and half brown for a little nutrition (it changes the texture a little but had the same great flavor as normal).
Our new staple!
Great recipe!
Delicious and easy! My babysitter said it tastes authentic!
This was terrific but I added shrimp and sesame seeds. I also used a touch of sesame oil. You can really add a variety of veggies or meat. It's a versatile recipe and quite delicious.

Seemed a bit bland to me but my two picky eaters loved it and asked to have the leftovers for lunch tomorrow. I added shredded carrots and eyeballed the oil and soy sauce. Definitely a better alternative to the frozen fried rice I've been feeding them lately.

The rice was so good. I made it without the chicken since we wanted steak and chicken on the side. paired it with the yum yum sauce. My husband couldn't get enough of it. I will definitely be making it again.

Be sure to use SHORT GRAIN rice when preparing this, and ideally, wash your rice twice first. (AKA rinsing the rise with water twice before cooking it). And be sure the rice is cooled off (put in the refrigerator or freezer for a bit to get the rice at room temperature.

Ah-maze-ZING! I followed the recipe exactly but ended up adding a splash of water for additional moisture, a splash of sesame oil, and a splash of teriyaki sauce to balance out the sesame oil while cooking. Go VERY easy if you use sesame oil; it can overpower this particular dish very quickly. A teensy bit though added a wonderful depth of flavor. All in all, an excellent recipe.

Made it the whole family loved it and I adjusted the soy sauce to our taste and I put the rice in the freezer for 1 hour. And I added the green onions at the very end. All in all the dish was amazing I plan on making it again. (I was unable to take a picture because the food was gone within seconds of it being made.)
I love this recipe! I added sesame seeds and three tablespoons of teriyaki sauce, and I also reduced the amount of soy sauce to two tablespoons. It was soooo delicious :)
Definitely my favorite fried rice recipe.

This rice was amazing, I made it with double the rice and me, my wife and her cousin killed it. Only complaint is I wanted more! Not to change the recipe but I added a tiny piece of butter, maybe 1 tablespoon, and some more oil and soy to compensate for the extra rice. My wife said it tasted exactly like the Hibachi rice from our honeymoon which she was obsessed with. I will add this to our top list of meals. Thanks!

I make this all the time. Kids love it. It’s as good as you’d get in a restaurant and you can customize it to your liking. I used 3 cups of rice but I undercook the rice, so it’s not too soft. My kids love the hibachi rice and they said my first few attempts at this were good but a little

I did add lots of veggies (broccoli, matchstick carrots, green beans, a little celery and water chestnuts.) Cooked using sesame oil rather than olive oil, and added some sesame seeds as well. I had more than 2 cups of rice (probably 3) and used 1/2 the soy sauce, but 3 tablespoons of teriyaki in addition, but I think with the extra rice and the add ins, I should have still used 3 tablespoons of soy sauce because it wasn't salty enough to me, and I am the type to rub salt off of potato chips. I forgot the cilantro, but I believe that would be a good addition for next time as well.

This was way easier than I anticipated, and the hubby loved it! I used brown rice instead of white, as that's all I usually buy. I've made it twice already! This will be a regular recipe for us, I'm sure. Cheap, easy, healthy.

I am not a big lover of rice but I have to say., This recipe was absolutely delicious. Was definitely a winner with the whole family. So simple to make. Will make this a staple in our household. I did use brown rice instead of white and had to go back and make a 2nd batch.
Made this twice. Once as the recipe says, and once I replaced the soy sauce with Teriyaki sauce. I like it much better with the Teriyaki. But both are very good.

We added teriyaki sauce after it felt like it was missing something the first time we made it. That made it more to our liking, but I still feel like it's missing something. I just can't figure out what! Good basic recipe though!

Amazing! I substituted the olive oil for 5tbsp of butter, used 4 eggs instead of 2 (we like a lot of eggs in our Hibachi rice), added 2 tbsp of chopped white onions and 5-6 tbsp of soy sauce instead of 3 tbsp. It was absolutly delish.
Made a slight modification and added tomatoes! Absolutely loved it!

This was my first attempt at stir fry- loved it! Only reason I rated it a 4 star is because I made modifications to make it as tasty as wanted. For those of you who hate people that do this, I'm sorry. Feel this is a great base recipe and go from there. My cooking is never to the book! 

Seasoning I added: salt/pepper, ground ginger and garlic. Based on my mood this can change! Chicken bullion is a nice add as well. 

Veggies added: Bok Choy, water crests, shiitake mushrooms, mixed veggies (peas, corn, whatever needs to be used) 

Frying everything like this was quick, easy and a great way to use up leftovers !

The only slight change I made to this recipe is that I used cubed seared chicken that I made in the skillet before I made the rest of the dish. Aside from that, my only advice is to cook the rice the day before and refrigerate it, like other reviewers have said. The dish was perfect for two people with just a little bit leftover, it would be a stretch to feed three people and it definitely needs a side dish to go along with it. I will be making this again because it tastes authentic and great!
I like using shrimp instead of chicken and adding in some veggies (peas and squash are good!)

This was so easy to make and incredibly tasty! I used 5 fresh garlic cloves (we love garlic) and it really kicked it up a notch. My husband hates anything rice, but he loved this and came back for seconds!

I've made this recipe a few times without the chicken, and every time, it has ended up amazing! My friends and family adore the change from our old recipe. (I've even been asked to make a big batch for a road trip coming up!) This is a very easy, very delicious recipe. It's also great if you have to substitute onion and garlic powder (for those times you're mysteriously out of fresh ingredients (; )if you don't mind the loss in texture.

This was so delicious and my family loved it! I only made two changes - I used 1/8 cup of oil (instead of 1/4), and added a cup of frozen mixed veggies (thawed) to the pan before I added the rice. So good!
My family loves this dish!!!!!

Good tasting easy recipe. I used brown rice instead of white and added some steamed peas, corn and 1.5 toasted quorn patty. Next time i'de probably add more onions for taste and extra oil for some crisp.
This was so easy. The kids helped me and they loved it. I know we'll be making this again, soon.
I'll try it again.
Wonderful recipe!! I added frozen peas to mine and it was fabulous!
So easy, ended up adding some frozen mixed veggies and the family just loved it! Will be making again, it's the perfect meal to use up leftovers!
Really good. Easy to make. :-)
so quick and easy! very adaptable

This was great! I made it with shrimp instead of chicken...seasoned and lightly sautéed the shrimp beforehand, then followed the recipe replacing chicken w shrimp. I've tried shrimp fried rice before and failed but this was delicious! Highly recommend!!

Made a couple changes used Jasmine rice cooked it earlier this morning and let it chill in fridge. Also added peas, carrots,mushrooms, and a lil ginger root. Will and oyster sauce next time. Cooked chicken and shrimp separately using soy sauce. Mixed it all together and came out great. The kids loved it !

This was great. Tasted just like getting it from a Chinese restaurant. It is very versatile (add anything you like and want) and easy to make. Make sure to use day old rice. Using fresh rice makes it mushy. I've made this for family and friends and they all wanted the recipe! This is a must try. I have added it to our regular recipe rotation!
Super yummy! We love to add veggies instead of the chicken or even shrimp. :)
I use this recipe often, exactly as written. It's delicious. My family (including our 5 kids that are still at home) CRAVE and request it often!
This was a very good recipe, instead of olive oil I used sesame oil and it gave it a little something extra.

We had this twice in a week because my kids asked for it again. Everyone enjoys it! This dish is also good made with wild rice and I agree with others who said letting the rice chill for a while before making the dish makes it better.
Love this recipe, as does my husband and teenage son. First time didn't have soy sauce, so used worchestire. Ok, but next time with soy sauce was much better!!!

It was so easy and very tasty. I've done it a few times now throwing in random veggies like broccoli and mushrooms. I usually use some white onion to that I throw in with the garlic and it's all been tasty.
